1.name: high-intensity cycling
1.description: A fast-paced, cardiovascular workout focused on endurance and power using a stationary or road bike.
1.warmup: 5-minute light pedaling followed by dynamic leg stretches and ankle circles.
1.warmup2: 5-minute light pedaling with gradual increase in resistance and quad/hamstring stretches.
1.exercise1-description: Focus on maximum effort while maintaining posture
1.exercise3-description: Engage glutes and quads, maintain a steady pace
1.exercise5-description: Recover while maintaining a steady pace
1.exercise6-description: Gradually decrease intensity and focus on breathing

2.name: medium-intensity cycling
2.description: A moderate cycling session ideal for improving stamina and maintaining fitness.
2.warmup: 5-minute easy pedaling with gradual increase in resistance and quad/hamstring stretches.
2.warmup2: 5-minute light pedaling with gradual increase in resistance and quad/hamstring stretches.
2.exercise1-description: Maintain a steady pace with moderate resistance
2.exercise2-description: Increase resistance and maintain a steady pace
2.exercise3-description: Focus on maintaining a consistent speed
2.exercise4-description: Engage core and glutes while maintaining a steady pace
2.exercise6-description: Gradually decrease intensity and focus on breathing

3.name: low-intensity cycling
3.description: A light cycling session focused on recovery or beginners' training.
3.warmup: 5-minute slow pedaling and deep breathing with shoulder rolls.
3.warmup2: 5-minute light pedaling with gradual increase in resistance and quad/hamstring stretches.
3.exercise1-description: Focus on maintaining a steady pace
3.exercise2-description: Maintain a comfortable pace while focusing on posture
3.exercise3-description: Increase resistance slightly while maintaining a steady pace
3.exercise4-description: Engage core and glutes while maintaining a steady pace
3.exercise6-description: Gradually decrease intensity and focus on breathing

4.name: high-intensity powerlifting
4.description: An advanced strength training workout involving maximum effort lifts.
4.warmup: 5-minute dynamic  warm-up including jumping jacks, squats, arm swings, and barbell complexes.
4.warmup2: Light barvell warm-up with mobility drills and dynamic stretches.
4.exercise1: 5 sets of 3 reps of deadlifts at 90% 1RM
4.exercise1-description: Focus on form and maximum effort
4.exercise2: 4 sets of 5 reps of squats at 85% 1RM
4.exercise2-description: Maintain a steady pace and focus on depth
4.exercise3: 4 sets of 5 reps of bench press at 85% 1RM
4.exercise3-description: Focus on form and maximum effort
4.exercise4: 3 sets of 6 reps of barbell rows
4.exercise4-description: Engage core and maintain a steady pace
4.exercise5: 3 sets of 10 reps of weighted pull-ups
4.exercise5-description: Focus on form and maximum effort
4.exercise6: 3 sets of 12 reps of overhead press
4.exercise6-description: Engage core and maintain a steady pace

5.name: medium-intensity powerlifting
5.description: A balanced powerlifting routine focused on technique and hypertrophy.
5.warmup: 5-minute warmup with light cardio, mobility drills, and band-resisted lifts.
5.warmup2: 5-minute dynamic warm-up including jumping jacks, squats, arm swings, and barbell complexes.
5.exercise1: 4 sets of 6 reps of squats at 75% 1RM
5.exercise2: 3 sets of 8 reps of deadlifts at 70% 1RM
5.exercise2-description: Maintain a steady pace and focus on form
5.exercise3: 4 sets of 8 reps of bench press at 70% 1RM
5.exercise3-description: Focus on form and maximum effort
5.exercise4: 3 sets of 10 reps of barbell curls
5.exercise4-description: Engage core and maintain a steady pace
5.exercise5: 3 sets of 10 reps of dumbbell lunges
5.exercise5-description: Focus on form and maximum effort
5.exercise6: 3 sets of 10 reps of incline dumbbell press
5.exercise6-description: Engage core and maintain a steady pace

6.name: low-intensity powerlifting
6.description: A beginner-friendly session focusing on form and mobility with lighter weights.
6.warmup: 5-minute brisk walk and joint mobility exercises, including bodyweight squats and shoulder rolls.
6.warmup2: 5-minute dynamic warm-up including jumping jacks, squats, arm swings, and barbell complexes.
6.exercise1: 3 sets of 10 reps of bodyweight squats
6.exercise2: 3 sets of 10 reps of kettlebell deadlifts
6.exercise2-description: Maintain a steady pace and focus on form
6.exercise3: 3 sets of 10 reps of dumbbell bench press
6.exercise3-description: Focus on form and maximum effort
6.exercise4: 2 sets of 15 reps of resistance band rows
6.exercise4-description: Engage core and maintain a steady pace
6.exercise5: 2 sets of 12 reps of glute bridges
6.exercise5-description: Focus on form and maximum effort
6.exercise6: 2 sets of 15 reps of seated dumbbell shoulder press
6.exercise6-description: Engage core and maintain a steady pace

7.name: high-intensity yoga
7.description: A vigorous, dynamic yoga session focusing on strength, stamina, and flexibility, often incorporating power yoga or vinyasa flow.
7.warmup: 5-minute dynamic flow including Cat-Cow, Downward Dog, and Sun Salutations, with wrist rolls and shoulder openers.
7.exercise1: 5 rounds of Sun Salutation B with jump transitions
7.exercise2: 30 seconds Warrior III hold each leg
7.exercise3-description: Focus on core engagement and control
7.exercise4: 3 rounds of Chair to Twisted Chair poses
7.exercise5-description: Focus on balance and core strength
7.exercise6: 2-minute cooldown in Pigeon Pose and Supine Twist

8.name: medium-intensity yoga
8.description: A moderately paced yoga session combining static holds with controlled movements, suitable for regular practice.
8.warmup: 5-minute sequence of gentle stretches, slow-paced Sun Salutations, and neck rolls.
8.exercise2: 30 seconds Warrior I and II on each side
8.exercise3: 1-minute Triangle Pose and Side Angle Pose
8.exercise6: 2-minute relaxation in Supine Twist and Savasana

9.name: low-intensity yoga
9.description: A gentle, restorative yoga practice aimed at relaxation and recovery, ideal for beginners or rest days.
9.warmup: 5-minute slow breathing with seated forward bends, neck stretches, and Cat-Cow poses.
9.warmup2: Neck stretches and seated forward bends.
